profile.name: Youyun (Peter) Zheng
profile.tagline: Building translational cancer genomics tools that connect mechanistic discovery to clinical decision-making.
profile.summary: I work at the intersection of cancer biology, genomics, and computation. My long-term goal is to practice as a physician-scientist in academic oncology while developing methods that improve diagnosis, treatment selection, and patient outcomes.

research_focus: Structural variant junctional insertions: identifying mechanism-specific template configurations and testing links to TMEJ-related biology.
Spatial tumor biology in low-grade central nervous system tumors: resolving niche structure, developmental trajectories, and cell-cell communication.
Translational computational oncology: prioritizing analyses that can ultimately inform molecular diagnosis and therapeutic decision workflows.

research_projects.title: Origins of Structural Variant Junctional Insertions
research_projects.summary: This project examines how templated junctional insertions arise in structural variants across somatic and germline settings, and whether template configuration patterns reflect distinct mutational mechanisms.
methods: Template detection framework for breakpoint-proximal sequence configurations.
Alignment-score and enrichment analyses across structural variant classes.
Statistical association tests connecting insertion depletion/enrichment patterns with pathway-level hypotheses.
highlights: Defined configuration categories with detectable enrichments by SV subtype.
Observed imperfect yet informative template matches in multiple contexts.

research_projects.title: Spatial Profiling of Low-Grade CNS Tumors
research_projects.summary: This project maps cellular composition and architecture in low-grade CNS tumors to test hypotheses about spatial niches, histology-linked developmental origins, and dysregulated local signaling.
methods: Xenium-based data processing and cell typing.
Spatial architecture analysis across tumor subtypes.
Integration of transcriptionally defined niches with histopathology readouts.
highlights: Detected tumor-type-specific differences in cellular composition.
Found variation in local spatial structure across histologies.

timeline.title: Clinical urgency and translational intent
timeline.description: Personal and clinical exposure to oncology highlighted unmet needs in difficult-to-treat cancers and shaped a physician-scientist trajectory focused on improving treatment options.

timeline.title: Biology + computation foundation
timeline.description: Built core training across biology and computer science while pursuing early bioinformatics, clinical trial methods, and cancer genomics projects.

timeline.title: Translational computational oncology
timeline.description: Worked on multi-omic analyses, machine-learning diagnostics, and liquid-biopsy initiatives with direct relevance to clinical molecular workflows.

timeline.title: Mechanistic genomics and spatial tumor biology
timeline.description: Developing rigorous methods to interrogate structural variant insertion mechanisms and spatially resolved tumor ecosystems in CNS malignancies.

timeline.title: Physician-scientist development
timeline.description: Focused on advancing translational computational oncology and preparing for the next stage of physician-scientist training.
